Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean, and convenient.”
Reviews.Author: Max_Salesmen
Reviews.Content: I always stay here during my I-70 road trips. The people are nice and the rooms are clean. It's a good price for a good room, so you pay for what you get. People get upset over the littlest things, carpet, walls, whatever - as long as the sheets are clean and it's quiet. I get it, it's not the Bellagio of the Midwest, but it's okay - you'll make it through.

Reviews.Title: “I would jot recommend, but people sleep under the bridges. Dogs are ok.”
Reviews.Author: RT4
Reviews.Content: Because of the car trouble I had to stay at this hotel. I admit, NOT all La Quintas are same. This is first one, where I would not stay even for free again. Semi trucks parked all around the property blocking 4-5 spaces at the time, when the dog show is in town, and management couldn't tell drivers to park at much bigger parking lot near by? Bad management. Dirty rooms? Bad management. I was checking out when guest was complaining about the same things. No blankets? The old paper thin throw was a bit thicker than bed sheets. Bathroom was looking just as rundown, with patched up holes, scratched bathtub... place is not getting any handyman's attention. Bad management sucking all the money out without doing any upkeep. Go and stay for few bucks more and get a good night sleep and enjoy the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Good Location, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Mark B
Reviews.Content: I agree with the other reviewers. This hotels high speed is decent, the tvs are nice, in fact, it was nice to have the option of the "theme" on the tv which was the moon over the ocean with the sound of waves. Nice way to coast off to sleep :) Only downside (we stayed for two weeks for business purposes) the TV guide menu was an hour advanced. You could never see what was currently on. Asked to get problem fixed, but never was addressed. Continental Breakfast was OK too. Robert was a good front desk employee though! If you are going to stay, try to stay on the BACK half of the hotel as there is a lot of noise from the expressway on the front side.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Could use newer carpet.”
Reviews.Author: Benjamin B
Reviews.Content: We came here after we had a horrible experience at the Days Inn across the highway. The room was nice and comfortable, but the carpet was a little stained and worn. It looks like the hotel is getting a little worn, in general. They have nice 32" flat screen TVs in the rooms, and the free wireless internet was fast. Just a basic hotel, and what you would expect for the price. Also, if you are military, they will give you a discount. The front desk was very nice and helpful. Breakfast was basic - waffles, eggs, breads, muffins, fruit, yogurt, and drinks. Not sure what is in the area, but there were tons of sirens form emergency vehicles going when we arrived, and we heard them later that next morning. There might be a fire station nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: becuzisaidso123
Reviews.Content: For the last four years, our daughter has been involved in a competition in Indianapolis. During that time, we've always stayed at this hotel based on price and location. After this most recent stay however, I can say that we will not be staying here next year. The property has become very rundown, and seems to be the new place to stay for truck drivers that are awaiting their next assignment from a depot located down the street. Our room was not very clean, and the carpet was very worn and dirty. I had to take a towel and wipe hairs off the vanity when I went to use the sink....ewwww. Also, there seemed to be random people always walking around the parking lot. My husband was approached by someone asking for money!! There is a Steak and Shake located directly behind that is open 24 hours; not sure if this had anything to do with it. We returned from our evening around 12:30 a.m. and there was a group of four guys hanging out by the main entrance smoking. Also, the breakfast bar left ALOT to be desired. I realize this is complimentary, but one waffle maker and some items to toast is not too exciting.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Becky F
Reviews.Content: I recently brought a group of teenagers there for the National FFA Convention. The staff was most courteous and helpful. There are several restaurants within walking distance and access to downtown was quick. The rooms were not fancy but they were clean and smelled fresh. We will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Older Hotel But Clean!”
Reviews.Author: cld5263
Reviews.Content: Hotel was dated a little bit but was clean. Rate was great and front desk handled the reservation very effciently.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean, comfortable, quiet”
Reviews.Author: NancyBoBancy
Reviews.Content: I stayed two nights for a business trip; it was perfect for my needs. Clean, comfortable and quiet, with free Internet and free breakfast. I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for Basic Lodging”
Reviews.Author: djkrun
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights over the Memorial Day (Indy 500) weekend. Our room was very clean and quiet (faced parking lot, not the interstate), free Internet, TV worked, decent bedside reading light, heat and A/C (used both), free parking, and good shower - everything that you would hope for in a budget motel. Staff was very friendly. Free breakfast is very minimal. Jogging in the surrounding neighborhood was very peaceful. Lots of restaurants and stores within a half-mile. Finally, the price was great.

Reviews.Title: “Basic convenient room”
Reviews.Author: Schneider231
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Indy one night while visiting son at college. Basic room, no frills. Very reasonable price, convenient restaruants within walking distance (Denny's, Cracker Barrell, Outback, Steak and Shake, Joes Crab shack.) Bare bones breakfast at hotel, no pool. Small rooms, friendly staff, Very convenient right off exit of I-70. Would recommend for an overnight stay on the way to somewhere else,

Reviews.Title: “Good motel, great value”
Reviews.Author: Cadillac22
Reviews.Content: The La Quinta Inn is located one exit east of the I-465 loop, and it's an ez-off/ez-on situation. I guess there are a couple of La Quintas on this side of town -- this is the one on Post Road. There is a gas station right by the motel, and a ton of restaurants within walking distance -- Wendy's, Denny's Steak and Shake, Cracker Barrel, Outback, and a few others. I think I might have seen a Joe's Crab Shack sign. Check-in and check-out were fast and friendly. The room and hallways were clean and the furnishings -- bedding, carpets, etc. -- were all very nice. The TV only had a few channels. The bed was pretty comfortable, and the wireless Internet was very good, even though I was at the end of the hall on the top floor. My room was on the front side of the hotel facing Post Road, I-70, and the I-70 entrance ramp, so there was a little bit of noise but it wasn't too bad. You may want to ask for a room on the back side which I would expect to be very quiet. Oh, did I mention the price is great? The quality of the motel is not quite up to the standards of a Hampton or Holiday Inn Express, but it was very good -- better than the vast majority of Super 8s or Days Inns -- and for the price (around 60 bucks with tax) I would call it a superb value in Indy.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: djkrun
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel several times and have never been disappointed. It is exactly what we want from a budget chain hotel. For us, it is a very convenient location with easy access to the interstate. Plenty of free parking. Six family-type restaurants within easy walking distance. Front desk is simple but friendly and efficient. Rooms are clean, albeit basic. Free breakfast is very basic. Surrounded by neighborhood, which provides us with plenty of space for jogging in the early morning. Most importantly, the price is right.

Reviews.Title: “basic and fine”
Reviews.Author: kiwifuz
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel on our way to Cleveland passing through Indy. The room was clean. Bed was comfy. Quiet hotel. I didn't necessarily notice the security issues that another review noted, but I can see that happening. It's honestly not the best part of Indy, but not the worst. The area is definitely so-so. Someone did scrape the bumper of my car in the parking lot. Could have been the guy wandering the lot with a broom but not sweeping trash. But that's my only downfall of the place. Which is honestly just the downfall of people not being able to drive.

Reviews.Title: “There are NO Security Cameras and the "Rent A Cop" does not do his job!!”
Reviews.Author: dean631
Reviews.Content: My family drove 10 hours from Atlanta to Indianapolis for my son to be in a competition. We checked in at 10:30 p.m. and went to bed. The next morning, my husband and son went out to the Van to get ready to leave. When my husband unlocked the van, he immediately noticed that our van had been broken into over night. These thiefs broke into our van by using some type of tool to punch our key hole out and then somehow got the door open. They ripped our dash completely off in order to steal our Pioneer stereo/navigation/back-up camera/XM stereo and amplifier (worth $4000). They then proceeded to tear up our van and found my husbands camera equipment ($14,000), rifled through every compartment imaginable and stole an IPOD, my daughter's bookbag with all her books and homework, my son's never worn brand new pair of NIKE tennis shoes, his personal competition bag with all of his gear, etc. Of course, when we told the front desk people, they were very courteous and helpful and said that they were surprised something like this happened. The police officer who came and took our report said that things like this happen at this hotel frequently and cars continually get broken into at the Cracker Barrel across the parking lot at least once a week. He said there are thugs all over the area that break in just to pawn the stuff for pennies on the dollar to get money for Crack!! When we checked in, I did notice a very young "rent a cop" in the lobby...apparently he doesn't patrol the parking lot like he should. This place knew they had a problem because I talked to another employee who admitted that was the reason they had a "rent a cop." There are NO Security Cameras anywhere on this property. There should be. Although, we were not able to park in front of the hotel, we did NOT park in the back. We parked right under a very bright light on the front side part of the hotel. My husband was furious beyond belief and my kids were scared to death! Despite all of this, my son made it to his competition, had to borrow some stuff to compete....we were going to stay until Sunday, but we drove half way home to Bowling Green, KY and stayed in a very nice La Quinta Security Cameras everywhere). Before we picked a hotel in Bowling Green, we personally talked to a Bowling Green police officer to make sure we were in a safe city. We stay in LaQuintas because they are dog friendly....however, I will call the Chamber of Commerce from now on to find out where the safe areas are.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Staff, Clean”
Reviews.Author: Shamrock1656
Reviews.Content: I can not say enough good things about this hotel. It was very clean, brand new paint. The beds were extremely confortable. The staff went out of their way to help me. I spent alot of time in the lobby on my computer and can honestly say I heard not one complaint about the staff or accomadations.

Reviews.Title: “Great budget hotel for leisure travelers with pets”
Reviews.Author: suebob
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent La Quinta -- obviously well-run and clean, with helpful staff. The rooms are completely comfortable. The hotel allows dogs without extra charge. The breakfast is more than adequate. There are four restaurants within walking distance; I suggest you drive somewhere for a meal.

Reviews.Title: “a very clean and nice place to stay. very happy with everything!!!”
Reviews.Author: nighthowl
Reviews.Content: we stayed for five days while visiting indianapolis. were very happy with our room. even used the wash machine and dryer twice. very quiet and totally enjoyed our stay.. will stay there next time we visit!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great service....poor quality musty, mouldy smelling rooms.”
Reviews.Author: jtjaknepper
Reviews.Content: The people at the front desk were great. The room I stayed in was worn and had a very strong musty / mouldly smell. I was traveling with a business companion. He was staying in another room at the hotel and had the same to say about his room. The place was just plain worn out grimy.

Reviews.Title: “Gross!”
Reviews.Author: kb111570
Reviews.Content: We had a room rate of $65.00 a night. The hallways had an floral greasy smell. Our beds were misshapen and very low to the ground. It looked like someone had thrown a tomato at the wall. There were drip marks and chunks stuck to the wall. The bathroom had body hair in the tub and all over the tiled floor. We complained to the night desk girl. She was very apologetic and offered to comp our first night and put us in a different room. We were so disgusted by then that we couldn't imagine crawling into the beds to sleep. So began our search for another hotel. We had arrived at the hotel at 1 am and had some difficulty in securing another room. We lucked out and found a room we were extremely happy with for $69.00 a night at the Country Suites and Inns at Caslteton.

HotelInfo.Name: La Quinta Inn Indianapolis East-Post Drive
HotelInfo.Address: 2349 Post Drive, Indianapolis, IN 46219
